page.title: 18TOURISM IN DEERNESS (1)
page.content: Quite a few{holiday cottages}are let for the summer season. Most of these cottages are older farmhouses renovated.{Beaches}around Deerness are a mixture of sand and stone, where there is much of interest to be found. Seals are often seen and heard. The {Covenantors Monument,}dated 1679, is now signposted and a pathway made over fields for public access. Well visited by locals and tourists, this monument stands in memory of the Covenantors lost off the prison ship 'Crown' which was wrecked on Scarvataing on a December evening. At the{Brough of {Deerness}there stands ruins of an ancient chapel which is accessible by land or sea.
